title: Stencil, Army font
content:
please help me identify this font. Thanx...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061119im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Showandtell620_5034.png)
author: jurrasic

comments.content:
Compare the letter forms and cut locations to Klim's Karbon Slab Stencil Bold:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061119im_/http:/typophile.com/files/KarbonSlabStencilBold_3602.jpg)
  
 [https://klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/karbon-slab-stencil/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061119/https:/klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/karbon-slab-stencil/ "https://klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/karbon-slab-stencil/")  
If you increase the weight of the font and fill in some of the cuts you would have a fairly good match.  
Don

This lettering comes from [The Guardian](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061119/http:/www.theguardian.com/data/series/show-and-tell). I'm pretty convinced this is a stencil version of their [Egyptian Headline](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061119/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fcommercialtype.com/typefaces/guardian/egyptian_headline). As alternative, you might like [Stag Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061119/http:/vllg.com/schwartzco/stag-stencil), also designed by Christian Schwartz.

Hi Ryuk, thanks for finding that this lettering comes from The Guardian.  
Guardian Egyptian Headline Black does indeed seem a fit if edited using the model in Karbon slab:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140124061119im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GuardianEgyptianStencilBlack_3687.jpg)
  
Don
